titles.title: Livestock Packer and Producer Fairness Act of 2002
To amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 to increase competition and transparency among packers required to report information on the price and quantity of livestock purchased by the packer.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Livestock and Horticulture.

bill.summary: 7/26/2002--Introduced. Livestock Packer and Producer Fairness Act of 2002 - Amends the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 to establish minimum per plant per reporting day purchase and slaughter requirements through spot purchases from nonaffiliated producers for a covered packer: (1) that is a cooperative; and (2) that is not a cooperative.Sets forth transitional requirements for a covered packer with a specified captive cattle supply.Defines "cooperative," "covered packer," "nonaffiliated producer," and "spot market purchase."
